bug.short_desc: terminator window moves between virtual desktops XFCE
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: Since I updated Fedora 24 to 25 I witness the following phenomenon. When I start terminator on a specific virtual desktop it opens up. All fine. When I go to another virtual desktop and start a second instance of terminator it will also open up. No problem. BUT: The first instance of terminator, which I opened before in the other virtual desktop will be moved to this second virtual desktop the moment I open up the second instance.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): Fedora: 25 XFCE 4.12 gdm-3.22.1-1.fc25.x86_64 terminator-1.90-5.fc25.noarch. Kernel: 4.9.9-200.fc25.x86_64 #1 SMP Thu Feb 9 17:28:13 UTC 2017 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
How reproducible: Open Terminator on virtual Desktop A. Go to virtual Desktop B and open another terminator window. The first window will then be also on virtual Desktop B instead of A. This happens every time.
Steps to Reproduce: see above
Actual results:
Expected results: first terminator window should remain on virtual Desktop A.
Additional info: Did not happen under the same installation with Fedora 24. Only happens with terminator application.
Please update to the latest Terminator 1.91. The issue should be fixed with that version.
